definition: take your time/take it easy
slow
slow
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: You don't have tol bust your ass all the time. 'cause life is going on.
sentences.chinese: 你不要总是那么拼命，人生还很长，要慢慢来。

sentences.english: A good goal will never failed because of the slowly.
sentences.chinese: 一个好的目标决不会因为慢慢来而落空。

sentences.english: He told me to take it easy, because it was no necessary to finish this work in advance.
sentences.chinese: 他告诉我要慢慢来，没有必要提前完成这项工作。

sentences.english: My doctor says I need to ease into it slowly. Cool?
sentences.chinese: 医生说我要慢慢来，明白吗？

sentences.english: "Corruption is still a problem, we would like to take it very slowly," he says.
sentences.chinese: “腐败仍然是一个问题，我们想慢慢来，”他说。

sentences.english: I studied at the sports university and therefore it was step by step.
sentences.chinese: 我曾经在体育大学学习，因为你必须一步一步慢慢来。
但这还需要我们慢慢来。

sentences.english: Take it slowly and pace yourself.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢来，走你自己的节奏。

sentences.english: Bob. B/Take your time. He called and said he would be late.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢来，他打了电话来，说会晚到。

sentences.english: Significant improvements are needed, and they can only come gradually.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要重大的改善，只能慢慢来。

sentences.english: So plenty of sex educators and therapists recommend taking your time for self-pleasure and treating yourself as well as you’d treat a partner.
sentences.chinese: 所以很多性教育者和医生都建议慢慢来。

sentences.english: When you're ready to begin exercising, start slowly.
sentences.chinese: 你准备开始运动时，慢慢来。

sentences.english: So, Zhao Tie Zhu intends to do it slowly.
sentences.chinese: 所以，赵铁柱打算慢慢来。

sentences.english: There is enough time. So take your time.
sentences.chinese: 时间完全足够，所以你慢慢来吧。

sentences.english: Let's do it slowly and correctly.
sentences.chinese: 让我们慢慢来，把它做好。

definition: Don't worry!
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
to keep cool/to stay calm
in sequence, step by step (idiom); to make steady progress incrementally
the future is long (idiom); there will be ample time for that later/We'll cross that bridge when we get there
hasty men don't get to eat hot tofu (idiom)/one just has to be patient/haste will ruin everything
pinyin: xin1 ji2 chi1 bu5 liao3 re4 dou4 fu5

definition: anxious/impatient
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
lit. to want to get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. to try to achieve one's goal in the shortest time possible/to be impatient for success
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 ge5 pang4 zi5

definition: to let nature take its course (idiom)
lit. when the boat gets to the pier-head, it will go straight with the current (proverb)/fig. everything will be all right/cf 車到山前必有路，船到橋頭自然直|车到山前必有路，船到桥头自然直
pinyin: chuan2 dao4 qiao2 tou2 zi4 ran2 zhi2

definition: to insist on/to demand/to impose
slowly
it doesn't matter
to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
